name: Linux-net-next
tagline: Friendly fork of the Linux net-next branch with additional patches for the 6LoWPAN stack
body:
Unofficial patch set(s) for the Linux Wireless Sensor Network project
======================================================================

What is this project?
---------------------

This project aims to provide the latest bugfixes on both the [IEEE 802.15.4][ieee802154] and
the [6LoWPAN][] stacks within the Linux Kernel to a wider audience.

On the long term, these patches should be incorporated to the *net-next* branch
of the Linux kernel. This page aims to regroup all of them, and provide them a
bigger exposure, for more extensive reviews.

Why does this project exists?
-----------------------------

While an fair number of very motivated persons work on the Linux [IEEE
802.15.4][ieee802154] and [6LoWPAN] stacks, most of them have very little time to actually push
their work to the *net-next* branch of the Linux kernel for inclusion, or seek
for more review before they do so.
Consequently, a newcomer to the project will spend a lot of time figuring out
where the most recent work is located, because it is scattered in so many places.

This project aims to tackle this particular issue, and to make it easier to
newcomers to have a recent and functional version of the kernel, benefiting
from the latest bugfixes.

How to use
----------

In order to retrieve a recent version of the net-next branch of the Linux
kernel and apply the patches on top of it, you need to perform the two
following step:
* clone this repository
* checkout the branch your interested in (e.g. *git checkout 6lowpan*)

How to contribute
-----------------

The proper way to get your patches reviewed is to send them to the Linux Zigbee
mailing list (<linux-zigbee-devel@lists.sourceforge.net>). You can find more on
the list (including the archives) [here](https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/linux-zigbee-devel).

If I see your patch(es) on the lists and find it sensible (yes, that's highly suggestive), I will include it in the sets here.
However if I fail to notice your patch, you can either send me a pull request, or your patches directly.

External links
--------------

* [Linux Zigbee](http://sourceforge.net/apps/trac/linux-zigbee/): home of the old (now deprecated) implementation. You are advised not to read documentation from this website as it is pretty outdated.
* [Linux WSN](https://code.google.com/p/linux-wsn/): place where the new documentation and code should go
* \#linux-wpan@irc.freenode.net: (unofficial) channel where some Linux WSN developers meet

Authors
-------

* Tony Cheneau <tony.cheneau@amnesiak.org> (or <tony.cheneau@nist.gov>)

[ieee802154]: http://www.ieee802.org/15/pub/TG4.html
[6LoWPAN]: https://tools.ietf.org/wg/6lowpan/
